answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
We're called "Charlottesville, VA - City Hall" on Facebook. The Communications Office (part of City Manager's) maintains the page. 
Personifying City Hall could be cool, especially if the building is well known or architecturally interesting --Pasadena or Richmond, VA.

answers.author: Hadley Skeffington-Vos
answers.text:
With Facebook's recent policy change, the City of Sterling changed their Facebook page name from "City of Sterling, IL" to "City of Sterling- City Hall" since we have all our departments under one Facebook page (including Police, Fire, PW, Mayor)

author: Tracy Miller
text:
Facebook recently started making local governments change their Facebook page name from a location to something else. Gainesville, FL was “City of Gainesville, FL” and has since changed it to “City of Gainesville, FL – where every path starts with passion” which is the tag line on the city logo. City representatives are hoping to change to something shorter. Have any of you found a creative Facebook page name for your city or county government? Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.  
Best Regards,  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation
title: Facebook Names for Governments
